text:
June 26 -- The first-ever NBA Awards aired live on TNT from Basketball City in New York featuring the traditional season-ending awards plus six new categories, all determined exclusively by fan voting.



Below is a complete list of winners:

Kia NBA Most Valuable Player | Voting Totals

Russell Westbrook won the 2017 Kia NBA Most Valuable Player Award.



Kia NBA Defensive Player of the Year | Voting Totals

Draymond Green's versatility helps win him the Kia NBA Defensive Player of the Year Award.



Kia Most Improved Player | Voting Totals

Giannis Antetokounmpo's breakout season earns him the Kia Most Improved Player Award.



Kia NBA Sixth Man Award | Voting Totals

Eric Gordon takes home the 2016-17 Kia NBA Sixth Man Award.



Kia NBA Rookie of the Year | Voting Totals

Malcolm Brogdon wins the 2016-17 Kia NBA Rookie of the Year Award



NBA Coach of the Year | Voting Totals

Mike D'Antoni's high-octane offense powered him to the NBA Coach of the Year Award.



NBA Basketball Executive of the Year | Voting Totals

[WINNER] Bob Myers, Golden State Warriors

Signing Kevin Durant last offseason helped Bob Myers win the NBA Basketball Executive of the Year Award.



NBA Sportsmanship Award | Voting Totals

[WINNER] Kemba Walker, Charlotte Hornets

Kemba Walker earns the NBA Sportsmanship Award.



NBA Cares Community Assist Award

[WINNER] Isaiah Thomas, Boston Celtics

Isaiah Thomas earns the NBA Cares Community Assist Award



Sager Strong Award

[WINNER] Monty Williams, San Antonio Spurs

Monty Williams receives the first-ever Sager Strong Award.



Lifetime Achievement Award

[WINNER] Bill Russell

Official release

Bill Russell expresses competitiveness and compassion while accepting the Lifetime Achievement Award.



#BestPlayoffMoment

[WINNER] Golden State's Kevin Durant hits pull-up 3-pointer late in Game 3 of The Finals

Golden State's hits pull-up 3-pointer late in Game 3 of The Finals Boston's Isaiah Thomas scores career-high 53 points amidst personal tragedy

scores career-high 53 points amidst personal tragedy Washington's John Wall with game-winning shot in East semifinals

Kevin Durant's clutch Game 3 wins Best Playoff Moment recognition.



#PerformanceOfTheYear

[WINNER] Golden State’s Klay Thompson scores 60 in three quarters vs. Indiana

Golden State’s scores 60 in three quarters vs. Indiana Phoenix’s Devin Booker 70-point game vs. Boston

70-point game vs. Boston Houston’s James Harden nets 53-16-17 triple double vs. New York

nets 53-16-17 triple double vs. New York Oklahoma City’s Russell Westbrook with most points in a triple double, 57-13-11, vs. Orlando

Klay Thompson's 60-point performance wins Performance of the Year honors.



#GameWinnerOfTheYear

[WINNER] Oklahoma City’s Russell Westbrook vs. Denver

Oklahoma City’s vs. Denver Cleveland’s Kyrie Irving vs. Golden State

vs. Golden State Phoenix’s Tyler Ulis vs. Boston

Russell Westbrook's dramatic finish earns the Game-Winner of the Year Award.



Hustle Award

[WINNER] Patrick Beverley, Houston Rockets

Patrick Beverley's all-out play earns him the Hustle Award.



#DunkOfTheYear

[WINNER] Oklahoma City’s Victor Oladipo vs. Atlanta

Oklahoma City’s vs. Atlanta Los Angeles Lakers’ Larry Nance, Jr. vs. Brooklyn

vs. Brooklyn Minnesota’s Zach LaVine vs. Phoenix

Victor Oladipo's poster wins the Dunk of the Year award.



#BlockOfTheYear

[WINNER] San Antonio’s Kawhi Leonard vs. Houston

San Antonio’s vs. Houston New York’s Kristaps Porzingis vs. Brooklyn

vs. Brooklyn Miami’s Hassan Whiteside vs. Toronto

Kawhi Leonard's denial of James Harden wins the Block of the Year award.



#AssistOfTheYear

[WINNER] Golden State’s Draymond Green to Stephen Curry to Kevin Durant

Golden State’s to to Denver’s Nikola Jokic with no-look pass

with no-look pass LA Clippers’ Chris Paul with wraparound pass

Warriors excellence produced the Assist of the Year.



Twyman-Stokes Teammate of the Year Award | Voting Totals

[WINNER] Dirk Nowitzki

Dirk Nowitzki receives the Twyman-Stokes Teammate of the Year Award.



#BestStyle

[WINNER] Oklahoma City’s Russell Westbrook
